channel.title: New sys-whonix - Doesn't recognize sdwdate from the other WS?
channel.description:
Hello,
I have accidentally deleted sys-whonix vm and have just created an app vm like described in the docs.
The problem is, when I look at the top bar and go for the qubes logo where I can check swdate of all running qubes vms, I only see the running gateway?
Is this normal behaviour? Is this dangerous in any way?

item.title: New sys-whonix - Doesn't recognize sdwdate from the other WS?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Use salt to (re-)install Qubes-Whonix.

Whonix – 25 Oct 20

HowTo: Install the Stable Version of Qubes-Whonix ™ 15

How to Install Qubes-Whonix ™ 15

Whonix – 25 Oct 20

Reinstall Qubes-Whonix ™ TemplateVMs: Stable Version

How to Reinstall Qubes-Whonix ™ TemplateVMs - Stable Version

salt attempts to configure dom0 according to specification and would probably show an error if something went wrong.

parallelanonmity:

Is this dangerous in any way?

Most of the time broken systray, broken desktop icon, start menu entries aren’t proof of anything.
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Malware#Indicators_of_Compromise

Read full topic
item.source: New sys-whonix - Doesn't recognize sdwdate from the other WS?

Hello,

I have accidentally deleted sys-whonix vm and have just created an app vm like described in the docs.

The problem is, when I look at the top bar and go for the qubes logo where I can check swdate of all running qubes vms, I only see the running gateway?

Is this normal behaviour? Is this dangerous in any way?
